description: The underlying cause of the issue described by CVE-2023-5996 is a use-after-free vulnerability in the Web Audio API of the Chromium open-source project, which can occur when an object is accessed after it has been freed from memory. This flaw can lead to a range of security implications, including remote code execution or application crashes. Microsoft Edge, which is based on Chromium architecture, ingests this software, making it susceptible to this flaw. The specific build numbers affected include Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) version 119.0.2151.58 and its extended stable counterparts. The security update resolves this issue, ensuring that the latest version of Microsoft Edge is no longer vulnerable as documented in KB-119.0.2151.58.
